alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 7:47PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Monroe County through 845 PM EDT... At 747 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Maybee, or 7 miles west of Carleton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Monroe and Carleton around 800 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Newport, Estral Beach, Scofield, South Rockwood, Woodland Beach, Oakville, Stony Point, Detroit Beach and Rockwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
